title: Understanding HTM-02-01 Compliance for Medical Gas Systems

children.text: HTM-02-01 is the UK Health Technical Memorandum that provides guidance on the design, installation, and maintenance of medical gas pipeline systems. While primarily a UK standard, it's widely recognized and adopted in many countries as a best practice for medical gas systems.

Key requirements of HTM-02-01 include proper color coding of gas pipelines, installation of appropriate outlet types, regular testing and maintenance procedures, and comprehensive documentation. Compliance ensures patient safety and operational reliability.

At Altair Medical System, all our medical gas systems and surgical pendants are designed and installed to meet HTM-02-01 standards, ensuring the highest levels of safety and compliance for healthcare facilities.

title: Benefits of Modular Operation Theatres in Modern Healthcare

children.text: Modular operation theatres represent the future of surgical infrastructure, offering numerous advantages over traditional construction methods. These prefabricated systems can be installed in a fraction of the time required for conventional building, minimizing disruption to hospital operations.

Key benefits include rapid installation (typically 5-7 days), seamless panel construction for easy cleaning, fully configurable layouts to match specific surgical requirements, and compliance with international standards including HTM-02-01 and ASTM.

Modular OTs also offer superior hygiene with anti-bacterial surfaces, integrated medical gas systems, and premium LED lighting solutions. They can be easily expanded or reconfigured as hospital needs evolve.
